ai.grakn.concept

Interface Type

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<Concept>, Concept
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EntityType, RelationType, ResourceType<D>, RoleType, RuleType

    public interface Type
extends Concept

    A Type represents any ontological element in the graph.

    Types are used to model the behaviour of Instance and how they relate to each other. They also aid in categorising Instance to different types.

    Author:
    fppt
    See Also:
    EntityType, RoleType, RelationType, ResourceType, RuleType

    • Method Detail

      • setAbstract

        Type setAbstract(Boolean isAbstract)
          throws ConceptException
        Sets the Entity Type to be abstract - which prevents it from having any instances.
        Parameters:
        isAbstract - Specifies if the concept is to be abstract (true) or not (false).
        Returns:
        The concept itself
        Throws:
        ConceptException - if this is a meta-type

      • plays

        Type plays(RoleType roleType)
    throws ConceptException
        Parameters:
        roleType - The Role Type which the instances of this Type are allowed to play.
        Returns:
        The Type itself.
        Throws:
        ConceptException - if this is a meta-type

      • key

        Type key(ResourceType resourceType)
  throws ConceptException
        Creates a RelationType which allows this type and a resource type to be linked in a strictly one-to-one mapping.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - The resource type which instances of this type should be allowed to play.
        Returns:
        The Type itself.
        Throws:
        ConceptException - if this is a meta-type

      • resource

        Type resource(ResourceType resourceType)
       throws ConceptException
        Creates a RelationType which allows this type and a resource type to be linked.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - The resource type which instances of this type should be allowed to play.
        Returns:
        The Type itself.
        Throws:
        ConceptException - if this is a meta-type

      • scope

        Type scope(Instance scope)
        Classifies the type to a specific scope. This allows you to optionally categorise types.
        Parameters:
        scope - The category of this Type
        Returns:
        The Type itself.

      • deleteScope

        Type deleteScope(Instance scope)
        Delete the scope specified.
        Parameters:
        scope - The Instances that is currently scoping this Type.
        Returns:
        The Type itself

      • getLabel

        TypeLabel getLabel()
        Returns the unique label of this Type.
        Returns:
        The unique label of this type

      • plays

        Collection<RoleType> plays()
        Returns:
        A list of Role Types which instances of this Type can indirectly play.

      • resources

        Collection<ResourceType> resources()
        Returns:
        The resource types which this type is linked with.

      • keys

        Collection<ResourceType> keys()
        Returns:
        The resource types which this type is linked with as a key.

      • superType

        Type superType()
        Returns:
        The direct super of this Type

      • subTypes

        Collection<? extends Type> subTypes()
        Get all indirect sub-types of this type. The indirect sub-types are the type itself and all indirect sub-types of direct sub-types.
        Returns:
        All the indirect sub-types of this Type

      • instances

        Collection<? extends Instance> instances()
        Get all indirect instances of this type. The indirect instances are the direct instances and all indirect instances of direct sub-types.
        Returns:
        All the indirect instances of this type.

      • isAbstract

        Boolean isAbstract()
        Return if the type is set to abstract. By default, types are not abstract.
        Returns:
        returns true if the type is set to be abstract.

      • isImplicit

        Boolean isImplicit()
        Return whether the Type was created implicitly. By default, types are not implicit.
        Returns:
        returns true if the type was created implicitly through resource(ai.grakn.concept.ResourceType)

      • getRulesOfHypothesis

        Return the collection of Rules for which this Type serves as a hypothesis.
        Returns:
